meanings.sent1: My primos always support me no matter what.
meanings.sent2: I love spending time with my primos during family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: My primos and I are like peas in a pod, always together.
meanings.sent4: She is my rock, my confidante, my primate among primos.
meanings.sent5: Growing up, my primos were my partners in crime, always by my side.

meanings.definition: The first or earliest form of something.
meanings.sent1: The primos of the invention were simple sketches on paper.
meanings.sent2: The primos of the novel were very different from the final version.
meanings.sent3: The primos of the cake were just the basic ingredients, nothing fancy.
meanings.sent4: In the primos of dawn, the world is quiet and peaceful.
meanings.sent5: The primos of a friendship are often filled with excitement and discovery.

meanings.sent1: He enjoyed smoking primos on special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of primos filled the room during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The primos he smoked were a rare and expensive blend.
meanings.sent4: She savored the primos, letting the smoke swirl around her.
meanings.sent5: The primos he offered were a symbol of friendship and camaraderie.
